Description: Flat, projecting rim sherd from Ionian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; interior reserved; exterior, thick white slip: black 'bow tie' pattern (simplified triple guilloche) on top of rim, black on its sides; reserved on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably from the same vessel as University College London, UCL 201. Possibly South Ionian.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 75, Nau 4, Pl. 1d)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.953)
